TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 510
TEI.2.document_title: Philadelphia merchants to James F Perry, 10-11-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: James F. Perry's bills for purchases in Philadelphia to stock his store in Texas. See text. (Omitted.)
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 510

body.div1: <pJames F. Perry's bills for purchases in Philadelphia to stock his store in Texas. See text. (Omitted.) >

div1.p: [In October, 1830, James F. Perry bought in Philadelphia a somewhat complete stock of goods for the store which he was opening in Texas. These bills, most of them dated October 11,1830, are omitted. The same is true of other bills of the next year, October 4-11, 1831.]
